question: In a subjective probability assessment, if a person believes the probability of an event occurring is 70%, what is the probability of the event not occurring?
solution:
The probability of an event not occurring can be calculated as:

\[
\text{Probability of not occurring} = 1 - \text{Probability of occurring}
\]

Given that the probability of the event occurring is 70% (or 0.7), we have:

\[
\text{Probability of not occurring} = 1 - 0.7 = 0.3
\]

Thus, the probability of the event not occurring is:

\[
\boxed{0.3}
\]
